H0.text: The meat substitute 'Quorn' is named after a village in which English county. Yorkshire

H1.text: The meat substitute 'Quorn' is named after a village in which English county. Lincolnshire

H2.text: The meat substitute 'Quorn' is named after a village in which English county. Nottinghamshire

H3.text: The meat substitute 'Quorn' is named after a village in which English county. Leics

A4.text: Hugo Meynell (1735-1808), who lived in Quorn, has a reputation as the 'father of modern fox-hunting'.

A5.text: The county's largest beer brewer is Everards.
